description.narrative: The proposed project would support Mexico's conditional cash transfer (CCT) program, Oportunidades, which serves slightly more than 5 million poor families. About 70 percent of these families are in rural areas, 16 percent live in semi-urban areas, with the remaining 14 percent in urban areas. The principal Project Development Objectives are: -Increase capacities in health, nutrition and education of poor families through human capital investment by promoting regular health check-ups, improving health status, and raising school enrollment and attendance rates. -Build sustainable connections between Oportunidades and other social lprograms of the Government of Mexico in order to improve health and educaiton outcomes for Program participants.

title.narrative: % of families complying with health conditions (with breakdowns for pregnant women and children , 5 and for indigenous and non-indigenous)

comment.narrative: AF: Include only families. Detailed breakdown no longer available

target.value: Original: Children <5: 99.1% Pregnant women: 99.0%AF revised target: 96%

comment.narrative: AF: Include only families. Detailed breakdown no longer available
Refers to families. Slight decline is probably related to the larger share of urban population in Program, where generally thereare more problems with compliance.

title.narrative: % of children complying with education conditions by age.

comment.narrative: Reason for drop in education compliance rates for upper secondary will be discussed with counterparts, but suggests importance ofexpanding the set of secondary education modalities which are recognized by the Program for the education transfer.

title.narrative: Number (and %) of Oportunidades schools participating in the Programa Escuelas de Calidad (PEC).
% of students who transition from lower to upper secondary school.
% of students who transition from primary to lower secondary school.
Number (and %) of Oportunidades beneficiaries with PRONABES scholarships.
Number of municipalities, localities, families and children in Oportunidades.

target.value: Maintain at least at current level

title.narrative: Implementation of PEI-CONAFE pilot with indigenous and non-indigenous families.

baseline.value: Pilot started. Proportion of Oportunidades beneficiaries participatingin PEI-CONAFE identified.

target.value: Impact evaluation survey for data collection regarding nutritional & development indicators from the children and their mothersinterviewed in the baseline survey; Summer 2011;Analysis of the impact evaluation survey data.End of the pilot study.

actual.value: Study on Pilot completed and delivered.

target.value: Analysis of the 2nd follow up survey data (effects estimation).End of the pilot study.
